intro: Dipcadi erlangeri, commonly known as the Erlanger's onion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous stem and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
